Package com.example.project_part_3.Database_functions

Class Database

java.lang.Object
com.example.project_part_3.Database_functions.Database
public class Database extends Object
The Database class provides a higher-level API for interacting with Firebase Firestore and Firebase Storage, mainly around User, Event, and Image_datamap objects.

Most methods return a Task that must be handled asynchronously via addOnSuccessListener(...) / addOnFailureListener(...). Example usage: 


 FirebaseFirestore ff = FirebaseFirestore.getInstance();
 Database db = new Database(ff);

 String email = "example@gmail.com";
 db.fetchUser(email).addOnSuccessListener(user -> {
     if (user != null) {
         user.setName("Dion");
     }
 });

 db.fetchUser(email).addOnFailureListener(e -> {
     Log.e("fetchUser", "Failed to fetch user", e);
 });

 db.addUser(new Entrant(...)).addOnSuccessListener(success -> {
     // success = true if user was added
     // success = false if user already exists
 });

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Database(com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore db)
    Creates a new Database wrapper using the given FirebaseFirestore instance and a default FirebaseStorage.

    • addUser

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Boolean> addUser(@NonNull User user)
      Add a User to the database if they do not already exist. Internally calls doesUserExist(User).
      Parameters:
      user - the User to add to the database
      Returns:
      a Task that resolves to true if the user was added, or false if the user already exists

    • addInterest

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Boolean> addInterest(String email, String newInterest)
      Add an interest string to the interests array of the specified user.
      Parameters:
      email - the email of the user (document ID in users)
      newInterest - the interest to add
      Returns:
      a Task resolving to true if the update succeeded

      Returns:

      oldInterest - the interest to remove
      Returns:

    • checkUser

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<User> checkUser(String email, String password)
      Check if a user exists and validate their password.

      This method calls fetchUser(String) and compares the stored password.

      Parameters:
      email - the email of the user to check
      password - the password of the user to check
      Returns:
      a Task that resolves to the User on success; throws if the user is not found or the password is incorrect

    • fetchUser

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<User> fetchUser(String email)
      Fetch a User from the database by email, resolving to the appropriate subtype. May return Entrant, Organizer, Admin, or plain User.
      Parameters:
      email - the email of the user to fetch (document ID in users)
      Returns:
      a Task resolving to a User instance, or null if not found

    • setUser

      public void setUser(User user)
      Overwrites a User document in the users collection. This is a direct setter and does not return a Task.
      Parameters:
      user - the User to persist

    • getAllUsers

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<List<User>> getAllUsers()
      Get a list of all User documents from the database.
      Returns:
      a Task resolving to a List of User objects

    • doesUserExist

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Boolean> doesUserExist(User user)
      Check if a given User already exists in the database by email. This method delegates to fetchUser(String).
      Parameters:
      user - the User whose existence is being checked
      Returns:
      a Task resolving to true if the user exists, false otherwise

    • addEvent

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Boolean> addEvent(@NonNull Event event)
      Add an Event to the database under its organizer's organized_events subcollection. If the organizer document does not exist yet, a minimal one is created.
      Parameters:
      event - the Event to add; must have a non-null organizerId
      Returns:
      a Task resolving to true when the event is created successfully

    • fetchEvent

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Event> fetchEvent(String eventId)
      Fetch an Event by its ID using the organized_events collection group.
      Parameters:
      eventId - the ID of the event to fetch
      Returns:
      a Task resolving to the Event if found; throws otherwise

    • getAllEvents

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<List<Event>> getAllEvents()
      Get a list of all Event documents from the organized_events collection group.
      Returns:
      a Task resolving to a List of Event objects

    • deleteUser

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> deleteUser(String email)
      Delete a User, their organized events, and associated images (profile picture and event posters). This method uses a WriteBatch to ensure consistency.
      Parameters:
      email - the email of the user to delete
      Returns:
      a Task that completes when all deletions are committed

    • deleteEvent

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Boolean> deleteEvent(Event event)
      Delete an Event and its associated top-level image document (if any).
      Parameters:
      event - the Event to delete
      Returns:
      a Task resolving to true once deletion is complete

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Boolean> updateEvent(Event event)
      Update an Event document using Event.toMap().
      Parameters:
      event - the Event to update (must have non-null ID and organizer ID)
      Returns:
      a Task resolving to true when the update completes

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> removeUserFromWaitlist(@NonNull String eventId, @NonNull String userEmail)
      Remove a user email from the waitlistUserIds array for an event, and also remove that event from the user's eventsAppliedFor list by calling removeEventFromUser(String, String).
      Parameters:
      eventId - the ID of the event
      userEmail - the user email to remove from the waitlist
      Returns:
      a Task that completes when all updates are applied

      Parameters:
      event - the Event whose status will change

      a Task resolving to true if the update succeeds

      entrantEmail - the email of the entrant to accept

      a Task resolving to true if the update succeeds

    • declineEntrant

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Boolean> declineEntrant(Event event, Entrant entrant)

      Parameters:

      entrant - the Entrant to decline

      a Task resolving to true if the update succeeds

    • declineEntrant

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Boolean> declineEntrant(Event event, String entrantEmail)
      Declines an entrant (by email) from an Event by calling Event.declineAttendant(String) and then updateEvent(Event).
      Parameters:
      event - the Event to decline the entrant from
      entrantEmail - the email of the entrant to decline
      Returns:
      a Task resolving to true if the update succeeds

    • uploadImage

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Image_datamap> uploadImage(@NonNull android.net.Uri imageUri, @NonNull String imageType, @NonNull String description, @NonNull String associated_user, @Nullable String eventId)
      Uploads an image to Firebase Storage, replaces any existing image of the same type for the given user/event, and updates both the nested metadata document and the top-level images collection with an Image_datamap.
      Parameters:
      imageUri - the URI of the image file to upload
      imageType - the logical type/category of the image (e.g., "profile_pic", "event_poster")
      description - a descriptive text associated with the image
      associated_user - the user ID/email to whom this image belongs
      eventId - optional event ID if the image is associated with a specific event; may be null
      Returns:
      a Task that resolves to an Image_datamap containing the uploaded imageâ€™s metadata once all upload and Firestore writes complete
      See Also:
      • deleteImage(String, String, String)
      • updateImageMetadataInDocument(Image_datamap, String, String, String)

    • deleteImageByUrl

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> deleteImageByUrl(@NonNull String imageUrl)
      Delete an image in Firebase Storage by its public download URL.
      Parameters:
      imageUrl - the Storage URL of the image to delete
      Returns:
      a Task that completes when the image is deleted

    • deleteImage

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> deleteImage(@NonNull String associatedUser, @Nullable String eventId, @NonNull String imageType)
      Deletes an image associated with a user or a specific event, including its metadata in Firestore and the actual file in Firebase Storage. The method determines the correct document to inspect based on the image type and optional event ID.
      Parameters:
      associatedUser - the ID or email of the user who owns the image
      eventId - the event ID if the image belongs to a specific event; may be null
      imageType - the category of the image, such as "profile_pic" or "event_poster"
      Returns:
      a Task that completes when all deletion operations (Firestore and Storage) have finished; resolves to null on success
      See Also:
      • uploadImage(Uri, String, String, String, String)

    • fetchImage

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Image_datamap> fetchImage(@NonNull String ownerId, @Nullable String eventId, @NonNull String imageType)
      Retrieves the stored image metadata for a user or event, depending on the image type.
      Parameters:
      ownerId - the ID/email of the user who owns the image
      eventId - the event ID if the image belongs to a specific event; may be null
      imageType - the type of image to fetch (e.g., "profile_pic", "event_poster")
      Returns:
      a Task resolving to an Image_datamap if found, or null if no image metadata exists

    • updateImage

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> updateImage(@NonNull String newDescription, @NonNull String ownerId, @Nullable String eventId, @NonNull String imageType)
      Updates the description field of an existing imageâ€™s metadata document.
      Parameters:
      newDescription - the new description text to write
      ownerId - the ID/email of the user who owns the image
      eventId - the event ID if the image belongs to a specific event; may be null
      imageType - the type of the image to update
      Returns:
      a Task that completes when the Firestore update finishes

    • listenToImageChanges

      public com.google.firebase.firestore.ListenerRegistration listenToImageChanges(@NonNull String ownerId, @Nullable String eventId, @NonNull String imageType, @NonNull com.google.firebase.firestore.EventListener<Image_datamap> listener)
      Registers a realtime Firestore listener for image metadata changes on a user or event document.
      Parameters:
      ownerId - the ID/email of the user who owns the image
      eventId - the event ID if the image belongs to a specific event; may be null
      imageType - the type of image to listen for
      listener - the callback invoked when metadata changes or errors occur
      Returns:
      a ListenerRegistration used to stop listening to document updates

    • deleteImageFromMetadata

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> deleteImageFromMetadata(Image_datamap metadata)
      Deletes an image file in Firebase Storage and its corresponding Firestore metadata document, then clears the image metadata from the ownerâ€™s nested user/event document.
      Parameters:
      metadata - the Image_datamap describing the image to delete, including ID and storage path
      Returns:
      a Task that completes once both the file and metadata have been deleted
      See Also:

    • acceptLotterySelection

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> acceptLotterySelection(@NonNull String eventId, @NonNull String userEmail)
      Marks a user as confirmed for an event lottery by moving them from selectedUserIds to confirmedUserIds and removing them from the other participation lists.
      Parameters:
      eventId - the ID of the event the user was selected for
      userEmail - the email of the user accepting the lottery selection
      Returns:
      a Task that completes when Firestore updates are applied
      See Also:
      • declineLotterySelection(String, String)

    • declineLotterySelection

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> declineLotterySelection(@NonNull String eventId, @NonNull String userEmail)
      Marks a user as declined for an event lottery by adding them to declinedUserIds and removing them from all other participation lists.
      Parameters:
      eventId - the ID of the event the user was selected for
      userEmail - the email of the user declining the lottery selection
      Returns:
      a Task that completes when Firestore updates are applied
      See Also:
      • acceptLotterySelection(String, String)
